title: Utah Firm Recalls Fully-Cooked-Not-Shelf-Stable, Ready-To-Eat Pork Roast Products Produced Under The Wrong Haccp Plan And For Mislabeling
summary: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22, 2013 Creminelli Fine Meats, LLC, a Salt Lake City, Utah, establishment, is recalling 31 pieces (approximately 101 pounds) of fully-cooked-not-shelf-stable, ready-to-eat pork roast products because they were produced under the wrong Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) plan and for mislabeling...

establishment.name: Creminelli Fine Meats
establishment.address:
310 Wright Brothers Dr. 
  Salt Lake City, UT 84116

impacted_products: 3-4-lb. packages of “Creminelli Artisan Deli Porchetta Seasoned Boneless Pork Roast”
